name: AggregateRumEvents
description:
Aggregate RUM events into computed metrics and timeseries.

This tool aggregates Real User Monitoring (RUM) events into buckets of computed metrics and timeseries. It is used when there is a need to analyze and visualize RUM data effectively.

parameters.name: rum_event_aggregation_parameters
parameters.description: JSON object detailing the parameters for aggregating RUM events, including compute metrics, filters, group-by rules, options, and paging.

interval.description:
The time buckets' size (only used for type=timeseries)
Defaults to a resolution of 150 points.

compute.description: The list of metrics or timeseries to compute for the retrieved buckets.

from.description: The minimum time for the requested events; supports date (in [ISO 8601](https://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime) format with full date, hours, minutes, and the `Z` UTC indicator - seconds and fractional seconds are optional), math, and regular timestamps (in milliseconds).

query.description: The search query following the RUM search syntax.

to.description: The maximum time for the requested events; supports date (in [ISO 8601](https://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime) format with full date, hours, minutes, and the `Z` UTC indicator - seconds and fractional seconds are optional), math, and regular timestamps (in milliseconds).

filter.description: The search and filter query settings.

facet.description: The name of the facet to use (required).

interval.description: The bin size of the histogram buckets.

max.description:
The maximum value for the measure used in the histogram
(values greater than this one are filtered out).

min.description:
The minimum value for the measure used in the histogram
(values smaller than this one are filtered out).

histogram.description:
Used to perform a histogram computation (only for measure facets).
Note: At most 100 buckets are allowed, the number of buckets is (max - min)/interval.

limit.description: The maximum buckets to return for this group-by.

missing.description: The value to use for logs that don't have the facet used to group by.

metric.description: The metric to sort by (only used for `type=measure`).

order.description: The order to use, ascending or descending.

total.description: A resulting object to put the given computes in over all the matching records.

group_by.description: The rules for the group by.

time_offset.description: The time offset (in seconds) to apply to the query.

timezone.description: The timezone can be specified as GMT, UTC, an offset from UTC (like UTC+1), or as a Timezone Database identifier (like America/New_York).

options.description:
Global query options that are used during the query.
Note: Only supply timezone or time offset, not both. Otherwise, the query fails.

cursor.description: List following results with a cursor provided in the previous query.

limit.description: Maximum number of events in the response.
